title: spec: document which built-in functions are legal in a go/defer stmt
body:
This example program groups built-ins by whether they may appear as the subject of a
'go' or 'defer' statement and whether or not that is ever useful.

http://play.golang.org/p/XkNQ6Y-vM8

As can be seen from this program, the compiler makes judgements about the legality of
the program that don't correspond exactly to usefulness.  The spec currently says
nothing, but it should describe the desired behaviour.
